page.title: 07Arts and Crafts in FINTRY
page.content:
There has for a number of years been a thriving art club in the village. It used to be centred on an evening class at the school, but when this stopped during education cut-backs, the class continued in the home of one of the class members.{There is an annual {"hanging party" in the village hall.
Looking for a hobby on retiring, being used to model making and playing the fiddle during his youth, a Fintronian has now taken up{violin making}in a big way. His instruments are of{such {good qualtiy that they have been the {subject of tv and radio programmes.
The idea for the hobby came from a friend. He{makes most of the special {tools himself}and usually produces three instruments per year. Currently he is trying his hand at a viola.
